article.headline: Gold futures post a gain for the session, climb for the week
article.body: Gold futures rose Friday, posting a gain for the week as the rise in COVID-19 cases in the U.S. and parts of the world raised the potential for another round of shutdowns to contain the spread. That lifted haven demand for the precious metal. August gold gcq20 rose $9.70, or nearly 0.6%, to settle at $1,780.30 an ounce. Prices for the most-active contract climbed about 1.6% for the week, according to FactSet data.
